result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christine Marie Ries

records.addlTxt: OP Acknowledgement of Receipt - Intake/Orientation Docs Christine Ries
1 year

2:16 PM Defendant Christine Marie Ries in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Christine Marie Ries.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CF238, 21CM136, 21CM196, 22CF45 heard at this time. ADA Schieffer requests the court approved the DJOC; guilty to 3 mids. bail jumping charges. Court recites the case number/count for the court record:  guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF238, Ct#3 in 21CM196 and Ct#2 in 22CF45. Atty Nelson and Defendant agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF238, Ct#3 in 21CM196 and Ct#2 in 22CF45. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF238, Ct#3 in 21CM196 and Ct#2 in 22CF45. Court dismisses Ct#1 in 21CF238, 21CM136, Ct#1-2 in 21CM196 and Ct#1 and Ct#3-5 in 22CF45. ADA Schieffer and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC for Ct#2 in 21CF238, Ct#3 in 21CM196 and Ct#2 in 22CF45. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. 2:39

ADDRESS INFO for Christine Marie Ries

Prior: 520 Plum Street, Red Wing, MN 55066 United States
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on September 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

8:39 AM . Defendant Christine Marie Ries in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Christine Marie Ries.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CF238, 21CM136, 21CM196, 22CF45. ADA Schieffer: guilty/no contest Ct#2 in 22CF45 with 1 year DJOC. Dismiss Ct#1, 3-5 in 20CF45, 21CM136, 21CM96 and 21CF238. ADA Schieffer addresses resolution of cases. Atty Nelson responds. Court is not going to accept the plea agreement; not convinced it's in the best interest of the public. 8:45 Court recesses.  8:57 Court resumes. counsel request a status hearing.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADA Schieffer states they have a resolution and would like to set a plea and sentencing. Court adjourned at 10:20 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:02 AM Defendant Christine Marie Ries appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF45, 21CF238, 21CM136 and 21CM196 (STC). Atty Nelson states there is an offer and would like to set a STC w/the Judge. ADA Schieffer is in agreement. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:05 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:10 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant Christine Marie Ries appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF45 (PH), 21CF238, 21CM136 and 21CM196 (STC). Court takes judicial notice of bond in 21CF238. Deputy Kale Huppert. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Deputy. Court reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:01 PM Defendant Christine Marie Ries appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Shelly Tomtschik appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walke is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NC L.M.G. or their residence and AS , no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:09 pm.
